member.name: M:SisoDb.ISession.InsertAs``1(System.Object)
member.summary: Inserts a single structure using the as the contract for the structure being inserted. As item, you can pass any type that has partial or full match of the contract, without extending it. E.g An anonymous type.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISession.InsertJson``1(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts Json strcutures using the as the contract for the structure being inserted.
member.remarks: Deserialization of the Json structure will take place, so If you do have the instace pass that instead using other overload!
member.returns: The Json for the item being inserted, but after insert so that the Id is included.

member.name: T:SisoDb.ISingleOperationSession
member.summary: Lets you perform Inserts, Updates, Deletes and Queries against the . This API should only be used if you perform a single call against the Db. If you make more than one subsequent call right after each other, YOU SHOULD USE INSTEAD.

member.name: T:SisoDb.ICache
member.summary: A cache for a certain type of identified by .

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.Clear
member.summary: Clears all cache for the structure set.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.Any
member.summary: Returns bool indicating if the Cache is empty or not.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.Count
member.summary: Returns number indicationg how many items the cache holds.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.Exists(PineCone.Structures.IStructureId)
member.summary: Returns bool indicating if there is a structure for the passed structure id in the cache.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.GetAll``1
member.summary: Returns all items contained in the cache.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.GetById``1(PineCone.Structures.IStructureId)
member.summary: Returns either null or the structure matching the sent id.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.GetByIds``1(PineCone.Structures.IStructureId[])
member.summary: Returns a cached result set for all, none or subset of the passed ids.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.Put``1(PineCone.Structures.IStructureId,``0)
member.summary: Called when an insert or update is performed against the . Should be used to update the cache.
member.remarks: Note! The structure being sent in should be returned by the cache.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.Put``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{PineCone.Structures.IStructureId,``0}})
member.summary: Called when an insert or update is performed against the . Should be used to update the cache.
member.remarks: Note! The structures being sent in should be returned by the cache.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.Remove(PineCone.Structures.IStructureId)
member.summary: Called when a structure is being deleted from the . Should be used to update the cache.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ICache.Remove(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{PineCone.Structures.IStructureId})
member.summary: Called when multiple structures are being deleted from the . Should be used to update the cache.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ICache.StructureType
member.summary: The Structure Type that this cache manages.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabaseMaintenance.SetRowIdsOn
member.summary: Will add a field called RowId to all tables. It will also (if the provider supports it) create a clustered index against this field, so that you could use replication, Azure etc.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabaseMaintenance.SetRowIdsOff
member.summary: Will remove the RowId field and associated index from all data tables.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabaseMaintenance.Reset
member.summary: Drops all structure sets and removes entries from SisoDb system tables.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabaseMaintenance.RenameStructure(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Renames a structure.

member.summary: Lets you migrate all structures from to . You can also control if a certain structure should be dumped by returning .

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabaseMaintenance.Migrate``3(SisoDb.Migration{``0,``1,``2})
member.summary: Lets you migrate all structures from to . Useful when targetting the same table and you only have one class for the model, hence and are the same. Then you can use a custom map type (anonymous or static) as . You can also control if a certain structure should be dumped by returning .

member.name: T:SisoDb.Dac.Profiling.IWrappedConnection
member.summary: This exists because SqlBulkCopy depends on SqlConnection and that class is sealed so we can't derive from it to add profiling

member.name: F:SisoDb.Maintenance.MigrationStatuses.Keep
member.summary: Indicates that you want to keep the structure and the new-structure will be persisted with the same id as the old.

member.name: F:SisoDb.Maintenance.MigrationStatuses.Trash
member.summary: Indicates that your are no longer interested in keeping the structure, hence it will be deleted.

member.name: F:SisoDb.Maintenance.MigrationStatuses.Abort
member.summary: Abort and rollback the process.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ICacheProvider.AutoEnable
member.summary: Gets or Sets a value, determining if a cache should be created automatically for a type, when the cache is consumed for the first time.

member.name: M:SisoDb.Caching.CacheProviderBase.OnCreate(System.Type)
member.summary: This is called in conjunction with http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee378677.aspx, hence, do not make it expensive. If, then implement and make one from scratch, or override and .

member.name: F:SisoDb.BackgroundIndexing.Off
member.summary: Default. Indexes are inserted along with structures and uniques.

member.name: F:SisoDb.BackgroundIndexing.On
member.summary: Indexes are queued and processed in the background. This means that structures and uniques will be inserted directly, whilst indexes will be inserted later. There will be eventual concistency between them.

member.name: T:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase
member.summary: Represents a database. An instance of a database is designed for being long lived, since it contains cache for structure schemas etc.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.EnsureNewDatabase
member.summary: Ensures that a new fresh database will exists. Drops any existing database.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.CreateIfNotExists
member.summary: Creates and initializes a new database if one does not exist.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.InitializeExisting
member.summary: Initializes an existing database by creating Siso-system tables.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.DeleteIfExists
member.summary: Deletes the databse if it exists.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.Exists
member.summary: Checks if the database exists.

member.summary: Drops the structure set, meaning all tables associated with the structure type.

member.summary: Drops the structure set, meaning all tables associated with the structure type.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.DropStructureSets(System.Type[])
member.summary: Drops ALL structure sets for sent .

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.UpsertStructureSet``1
member.summary: Manually upserts a structure set, meaning all tables for the structure type will be created.
member.remarks: This is normally something you do not need to do. This is done automatically.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.UpsertStructureSet(System.Type)
member.summary: Manually upserts a structure set, meaning all tables for the structure type will be created.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.BeginSession
member.summary: Creates an , used for inserts, updates, deletes and searching. The Session is designed for being short lived. Create, consume and dispose.

member.name: M:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.UseOnceTo
member.summary: Use when you want to execute a single search operation against the via an .
member.remarks: If you need to do multiple queries, inserts etc, then use instead.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.LockObject
member.summary: Lock object used to synchronize work against Db-operations.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.Name
member.summary: The name of the database.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.ConnectionInfo
member.summary: Connection info for the database.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.ProviderFactory
member.summary: Provider factory.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.Settings
member.summary: Runtime settings associated with the db.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.CacheProvider
member.summary: By assigning a you get the possibility of preventing the query from hitting the database for certain queries.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.CachingIsEnabled
member.summary: Get a value indicating if the Database has a assigned.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.StructureSchemas
member.summary: Cached Structure schemas, which holds information about members to index etc.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.SchemaManager
member.summary: Manager used to control Db-Schemas.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.StructureBuilders
member.summary: Structure builders collection used to resolve a Structure builder to use when building structures for insert and updates.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.Serializer
member.summary: The serializer used to handle Json.

member.name: P:SisoDb.ISisoDatabase.Maintenance
member.summary: Used for maintenance tasks of the database. E.g Regeneration of query indexes and Migrations.

member.name: P:SisoDb.IDbSettings.MaxInsertManyBatchSize
member.summary: Controls the maximum size of each batch used for inserting many structures.

member.name: P:SisoDb.IDbSettings.MaxUpdateManyBatchSize
member.summary: Controls the maximum size of each batch used for updating many structures.

member.name: P:SisoDb.IDbSettings.AllowUpsertsOfSchemas
member.summary: DEFAULT IS: True. Controls if upserting of structureset schemas should be allowed or not. If (true), then ONCE per , table-schemas are created on the fly. If (false), then the structureset allready has to be upserted before. This is useful when you have deployed and settled upon your design. If you then set it to (true), you will get a small performance boost, since it will not check if tables exists etc. the first time you use a certain structure.

member.name: P:SisoDb.IDbSettings.SynchronizeSchemaChanges
member.summary: DEFAULT IS: True. Controls if a synchronization between your code model and query-index tables should be performed (true) or not (false). If (true), then ONCE per , schemas are synhronized on the fly. Hence a compare between your code model, e.g c-sharp class Person and the keys (memberpaths) in each query index table for Person is synchronized.

member.name: T:SisoDb.ISisoDatabaseFactory
member.summary: Factory used to create an which is the starting point to consume SisoDb.

member.name: T:SisoDb.Dac.Profiling.IWrappedTransaction
member.summary: This exists because SqlBulkCopy depends on SqlTransaction and that class is sealed so we can't derive from it to add profiling
